messages: e387da377a5d744c74ccf6b6740b43aa (10:31): So, I have a question regarding html and css
e387da377a5d744c74ccf6b6740b43aa (10:31): I should obviously use a <ul> to display a list, or a navigation bar
e387da377a5d744c74ccf6b6740b43aa (10:32): However, I'd like to display it horizontally instead of vertically
e387da377a5d744c74ccf6b6740b43aa (10:32): Is there a way to change the orientation of a <ul> ?
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (10:39): either li { displat: inline; }   or li { float: left; }
e7e98fe845037733a8d2be68e4a65e3d (10:42): toraton, you may find this useful: http://alistapart.com/articles/taminglists/
e7e98fe845037733a8d2be68e4a65e3d (10:42): i'm actually working on that now (i have the problem that all <li>s are on top of one another)
e6e92533696423d92b1c52043f7e4da2 (10:47): Ok, that <marquee> bit has to stay for now, it's only temporary.

e6e92533696423d92b1c52043f7e4da2 (10:50): here goes my problem:  go to www.bevlistings.ca  & select one of the listings on the left.  At 800x600 in IE, you will be presented with an ugly horizontal scrollbar.  In FF there's no scrollbar to be seen.  I've tried resizing photos, increasing % of the submenu, floating text/photos, and i'm stumped.  How can I get rid of the scrollbar in IE?
dc8738f2e5e93ea2b50c2db14f7be0d5 (10:50): i mean the other left <-")
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (10:52): you seem to have an awful lot of seemingly  unneccesary divs
e387da377a5d744c74ccf6b6740b43aa (10:56): mick_home: Thanks for the link.
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (10:59): like, why are your headings in divs?
e6e92533696423d92b1c52043f7e4da2 (11:01): sloppy instructing?  I'm a student, new at this.
e387da377a5d744c74ccf6b6740b43aa (11:01): it can't grab my CSS
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:03): vilefridge: I suspect you may need a refresher course in display types...
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (11:04): good short overview of semantic html, but I highly recommend the cederholm book
e6e92533696423d92b1c52043f7e4da2 (11:07): FunkyBob, so no insight on the scrollbar prob?
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:12): I thought you might want to strip out the pointless div elements first.
e6e92533696423d92b1c52043f7e4da2 (11:12): 800x600 on the bevlistings.ca/listings.html   page using Internet Explorer only.  Firefox is ok.
e6e92533696423d92b1c52043f7e4da2 (11:15): no worries, thanks anyways.  anyone else?
a1979d8ea4467681752d9e87e36b669c (11:21): is there anyway to reference a style sheet that resides outside of the document root?
3c26b6648764f1ab4360aa71da5d760b (11:23): just use a full URL rather than a relative one
a1979d8ea4467681752d9e87e36b669c (11:23): I mean outside of the webservers document root.. for example my document root is /blah/htdocs but I want to include a style sheet from /blah/css
7fcac6e79024254d76585eb1e59cf415 (11:25): rshadow:  a client could never go outside the docroot
7fcac6e79024254d76585eb1e59cf415 (11:25): only server side stuff can do that
3c26b6648764f1ab4360aa71da5d760b (11:25): And you can't retrieve stuff that isn't served
a1979d8ea4467681752d9e87e36b669c (11:25): I mean I guess I could do it with some php.. but I guess I'll just place it somewhere inside of the document root
